action.content: Turn 0

You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the sandwich in the freezer, the plate on the shelf and the mop on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a bedroom now. There are a bed and a wardrobe. The wardrobe is closed. There is a passage to a hallway here.
> open wardrobe
Turn 1
The wardrobe is now open. In the wardrobe there is a pillow.
> go to hallway
Turn 2
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a bedroom, a broom closet and a kitchen here.
> go to kitchen
Turn 3
You are in a kitchen now. There are a cupboard, a counter and a refrigerator. The cupboard is closed. The refrigerator is closed. There are passages to a pantry, a hallway and a living room here.
> open refrigerator
Turn 4
The refrigerator is now open. In the refrigerator there are a apple, a sandwich, a peach, a orange and a banana.
> take sandwich
Turn 5
You take the sandwich. In your inventory you have a sandwich.
> open cupboard
Turn 6
The cupboard is now open. In the cupboard there is a plate.
> take plate
Turn 7
You take the plate. In your inventory you have a sandwich and a plate.
> go to hallway
Turn 8
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a bedroom, a broom closet and a kitchen here.
> go to bedroom
Turn 9
You are in a bedroom now. There are a bed, a pillow and a wardrobe. The pillow is in the wardrobe. The wardrobe is open. There is a passage to a hallway here.

> put pillow on bed


> go to hallway


> go to broom closet


> take mop


> go to kitchen


> put sandwich in freezer


> put plate on counter


> put mop on table


> done
